events.originalText: An overloaded balcony collapsed in Chicago, United States, killing 13 people and injuring 57 others.
events.subtitle: 2003 Chicago balcony collapse
events.headline: Balcony collapse in Chicago kills 13, injures 57

events.originalText: Atlantis became the first U.S. Space Shuttle to dock with the Russian space station Mir as part of the Shuttle–Mir program.
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Atlantis
events.headline: Atlantis docks with Russian space station Mir

events.originalText: The Soyuz 11 spacecraft experienced uncontrolled decompression during preparations for reentry, killing Soviet cosmonauts Vladislav Volkov, Georgy Dobrovolsky and Viktor Patsayev—the only human deaths to have occurred in space.
events.subtitle: Soyuz 11
events.headline: Soyuz 11 spacecraft experiences fatal decompression

events.originalText: Actress Jayne Mansfield, her boyfriend Sam Brody, and their driver were killed in a car accident outside of New Orleans, while her children Miklós, Zoltán, and Mariska Hargitay escaped with only minor injuries.
events.subtitle: Jayne Mansfield
events.headline: Actress Jayne Mansfield killed in car accident

events.originalText: The United States defeated England during the FIFA World Cup in one of the greatest upsets in the competition's history.
events.subtitle: United States men's national soccer team
events.headline: US defeats England in FIFA World Cup upset

events.originalText: The United States Army Air Corps aircraft Bird of Paradise landed at Wheeler Field on the Hawaiian island of Oahu to complete the first transpacific flight.
events.subtitle: United States Army Air Corps
events.headline: Bird of Paradise completes first transpacific flight

events.originalText: More than 50,000 Union and Confederate veterans gathered at the Gettysburg Battlefield, the largest combined reunion of American Civil War veterans ever held.
events.subtitle: Union Army
events.headline: Gettysburg Battlefield hosts largest Civil War veteran reunion

events.originalText: Hyde Park and several other Illinois townships voted to be annexed by Chicago, forming the largest city by area in the United States and the second-largest by population.
events.subtitle: Hyde Park Township, Cook County, Illinois
events.headline: Hyde Park annexed by Chicago, forming largest US city by area

events.originalText: A passenger train fell through an open swing bridge into the Richelieu River near present-day Mont-Saint-Hilaire, Quebec, killing as many as 99 people and injuring 100 others in Canada's worst railway accident.
events.subtitle: Swing bridge
events.headline: Train falls into Richelieu River, killing 99 in Canada

events.originalText: The first privateer battle of the American Revolutionary War, the Battle of Turtle Gut Inlet, was fought near Cape May, New Jersey.
events.subtitle: Privateer
events.headline: Battle of Turtle Gut Inlet marks privateer battle in Revolutionary War

events.originalText: One of the strongest tornadoes in history (pictured) struck Woldegk (in present-day northeastern Germany), killing one person.
events.subtitle: 1764 Woldegk tornado
events.headline: Historic tornado strikes Woldegk, killing one

events.originalText: The original Globe Theatre in London burned to the ground after a cannon employed for special effects misfired during a performance of Henry VIII and ignited the roof.
events.subtitle: Globe Theatre
events.headline: Globe Theatre in London burns down during performance
